bibl.title: Telegram from Vernon W. Lippard to Philip Showalter Hench, November 28, 1952

div1.p: Lippard inquires if Cooke should be included on the wreath representing the University of Virginia School of Medicine at the Camp Lazear dedication. Cooke, who died recently, was also a Virginia alumnus.

div1.head: Telegram from Vernon W. Lippard to Philip Showalter Hench, November 28, 1952
div1.opener:
CLASS OF SERVICE
-----
This is a full-rate
Telegram or Cable-
gram unless its de-
ferred character is in-
dicated by a suitable
symbol above or pre-
ceding the address.
WESTERN
UNION
W. P. MARSHALL, PRESIDENT
1201
(26).
__________________________________________________
The filing time shown in the date line on telegrams and day letters is STANDARD TIME at point of origin. Time of receipt is STANDARD TIME at point of destination
MA148 RA206
R.CVA124 PD= CHARLOTTESVILLE VIR 28 222P=
1952 NOV 28 PM 1 36
DR PHILIP HENCH= THE MAYO CLINIC= ROCHESTER MINN=
div1.p:
SHOULD NOT ROBERT PAGE COOKE ALSO BE RECOGNIZED IN PLACING
THE WREATH HE IS A VIRGINIA ALUMNUS INCIDENTALLY HE DIED AT
LEXINGTON VIRGINIA ON OCTOBER 27 1952=
div1.closer:
VERNON W LIPPARD= 27 1952=
THE COMPANY WILL APPRECIATE SUGGESTIONS FROM ITS PATRONS CONCERNING ITS SERVICE.
